items.title: Over 20 killed by intense Russian attacks - Does Ukraine have a weakened hand? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Russia's heavy attacks have killed over twenty people in Ukraine. The eastern city of Dobropillia was worst hit. Ukraine's interior ministry says Russian forces fired ballistic missiles, multiple rockets and drones. 

Kristine Berzina is a senior fellow and head of the geopolitics team at the German Marshall Fund and speaks from Washington to DW about the deadly attacks. 

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Poland opens their first abortion center that uses pills to terminate pregnancies | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Tens of thousands of people have marched through central Berlin to celebrate International Women's Day. They came together to call for equal opportunities, gender and sexual self-determination, as well as an end to gender-based violence. Berlin is one of only two German states that treat International Women's Day as an official public holiday.

Poland also hosted demonstrations for International Women's Day. Activists opened the country's first center where women can have abortions using pills. It's located directly opposite the parliament building. The predominantly Catholic country has some of the most restrictive abortion laws in Europe, but the frontrunner in this year's presidential election aims to change that.

00:00 International Women's Day in Germany
01:34 Abortion center opens in Poland 

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Intensified Russian attacks: How important is it for Putin to claim victory in Kursk? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>More than a dozen people have been killed in Ukraine, during heavy overnight attacks by Russia. The eastern city of Dobropillia was worst hit. Ukraine's interior ministry says Russian forces fired ballistic missiles, multiple rockets and drones. Eight apartment blocks were severely damaged. At least 11 people were killed there, including five children. Another three civilians were killed in a separate drone attack on the Kharkiv region. That's amid reports that Ukrainian forces are being pushed back on the battlefield

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Massacre of Alawites continues in Syria | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Hundreds of people from Syria's Alawite religious minority have been killed in the worst violence there since the fall of dictator Bashar al-Assad in December. The UK-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said it received reports of revenge killings by the new government's security forces in the coastal region. 

Chapters:
00:00 Hundreds dead in Syria revenge killings
00:31 Daniel Gerlach, Middle East expert and editor-in-chief of Zenith magazine
04:20 Fawaz Gerges, London School of Economics

items.title: Germany: CDU/CSU and SPD to begin formal coalition negotiations | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>The parties negotiating Germany's next coalition government have reached an agreement in their exploratory talks, conservative bloc leader Friedrich Merz said on Saturday. Merz's Christian Democratic Union (CDU) and its Bavaria-only sister party, the Christian Social Union (CSU) will now move to formal negotiations to form a government with the center-left Social Democrats (SPD) of outgoing chancellor Olaf Scholz, the parties agreed.

Chapters:
00:00 CDU/CSU and SPD to begin formal coalition negotiations
00:55 Alex Gerst, DW Correspondent


For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.author: DW News
items.content:

items.title: The Africa Gender Index tracks the current state of women’s rights in African countries | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Averaging-out all of Africa's diverse nations is something of a blunt tool but it does provide a picture — and the Africa Gender Index did the math. A score of 100 percent would mean full equality with men. African women are a long way from that.
 
In 2023, African women scored just over 50 percent — so only halfway to complete gender equality across economic, social, and public leadership areas. It is a sobering statistic that shows only a slight improvement from 48.6 percent in 2019.
 
But there is some light in the darkness: Namibia, the highest-ranking country in the continent, scores 88 percent. The report calls it 'the African champion of gender equality'. Tiny Lesotho, a gender equality giant, scores 82 percent. Its constitution guarantees equal pay for women and men. And Rwanda scores almost 80 percent — The report says it has a 'strong political will for gender equality'. That might have something to do with the fact that 61 percent of Rwanda's elected representatives are women.
 
But elsewhere, the landscape is less promising. In regard to the extent to which men and women participate equally in decision-making in politics, government and business, things have improved slightly but that rate is so slow, it would take until 2063 for African women to achieve full equality.

From: DW News Africa with Michael Okwu, 6 March 2025


For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

Follow DW on social media:

items.title: After Russian strikes on Kharkiv: US and Ukraine to hold talks in Saudia Arabia | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>America's top diplomat Marco Rubio says US president Donald Trump is determined to end the war in Ukraine 'as soon as possible'. In a call with Ukraine's foreign minister, he said all sides must take steps to secure a sustainable peace. Trump is ‘strongly considering’ to pose new sanctions and tariffs on Russia after its latest attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure. 
At least 8 people were injured and dozens of buildings damaged in the latest round of Russian strikes on Kharkiv. The Ukrainian air force said that they shot down over 67 missiles and 200 drones launched by Russia during an overnight attack on several regions in Ukraine.
Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said that communication with Washington was ongoing.

0:00 US and Ukraine to hold talks in Saudi Arabia next week 
3:02 DW Russia analyst Konstantin Eggert in Vilnius

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Ghanaian boxer Abigail Quartey has won her title despite facing prejudice | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Ghana’s first ever female boxing champion Abigail Kwartekaa Quartey has achieved the world bantamweight title –  and is her nation's pride and joy. Her achievements with the Black Bombers, the national team, made history for her country. But while becoming a fighter she found she had to battle far more powerful opponents than those she faced in the ring: the naysayers who insist women can't be fighters.  

Report from:
DW News Africa with Michael Okwu, 6 March 2025

#ghana #africa #worldwomensday 

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Hollywood actor Gene Hackman and his wife Betsy Arakawa died of natural causes | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Medical examiners provide more answers following the deaths of Hollywood actor Gene Hackman and his wife. They reveal the actor died a full week after Betsy Arakawa - and likely was unaware of her demise due to Alzheimer's disease. While the pair lived very privately, their deaths sent shockwaves through their community --- and through Hollywood.
